content: Yes, it's true that buying organic produce can be better for the welfare of farm workers. Organic farming practices often involve the use of fewer pesticides and herbicides, which can reduce the exposure of farm workers to these chemicals. Additionally, organic farmers often prioritize the safety and well-being of their workers by providing them with safer working conditions, fair wages, and health benefits. By buying organic produce, consumers can support these more responsible and ethical farming practices, which can, in turn, benefit the welfare of farm workers.
